DOC.brief_summary: Abstract Objectives : Primary : To study association central aortic blood pressure index coronary artery disease patient undergo elective angiography . Secondary : ( ) To study whether association exist central aortic pressure index incidence major adverse cardiovascular event ( MACE ) patient 6 month follow period . ( b ) To study whether association exist central aortic pressure peripheral pressure . Methods : The investigator conduct prospective observational study consecutive patient undergo coronary angiography . Central peripheral pressure invasively record coronary artery disease ( CAD ) classify obstructive non-obstructive group . CAD severity grade use Gensini score subject divide tertiles . Patients follow role central aortic pressure index prediction cardiovascular event analyse .
DOC.brief_title: The Association Between Central Aortic Blood Pressure Indices Severity Coronary Artery Disease
DOC.criteria: Patients undergo elective angiography diagnosis CAD . Age > 18 year Patients acute myocardial infarction , unstable angina thromboembolism precede 3 month . More mild valvular heart disease . Renal impairment serum creatinine > 1.5 mg % . Unable obtain full study coronary artery . Peripheral vascular occlusive disease . Post coronary artery bypass grafting ( CABG ) Heart rate < 50/min > 120/min arrhythmia . Contraindications coronary angiography . Unable provide write informed consent
